Description: Shallow bronze blade of a battle-axe: it has 15 binding-holes, which are evenly spaced but slightly misaligned. The butt is very slightly concave. The axe has been cleaned of corrosion product and is in good condition, though there is considerable surface abrasion on one face. The cutting edge is not very sharp, and there are no definite signs of wear.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (66)
